batchYeasts.description: LalBrew New England is an ale strain selected specifically for its ability to produce a unique fruit-forward ester profile desired in East Coast styles of beer. A typical fermentation with LalBrew New England will produce tropical and fruity esters, notably stone fruits like peach. Through expression of a Î²-glucosidase enzyme, LalBrew New England can promote hop biotransformation and accentuate hop flavor and aroma. LalBrew New England exhibits medium to high attenuation with medium flocculation, making it a perfect choice for East Coast style ales.
batchYeasts.name: New England

batchHops.name: HBC 431
batchHops.notes: HBC 431 is an experimental hop variety from the Hop Breeding Company, which is a joint venture between John I. Haas and Yakima Chief Ranches. The aroma of HBC 431 has been described as "peaches, berries, and tropical fruits... along with much citrus, herbal, and earthy notes."

batchMiscs.name: NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water

notes.note: Added 2.04 grams Citra, 2.02 grams HBC 431 and 1.99 grams Centennial pellet hops to the FV.

batchFermentables.notes: As used in Pilsner, âLagerbierâ, alcohol-reduced Beer, Light Beer and Bock Beer amongst others at a rate of up to 10 %. Use for foam improvement, improved head retention, fuller body. The lightest of the crystal malts.

batchFermentables.name: Pale Ale Malt
batchFermentables.notes: BEST Pale Ale deepens the light âgoldenâ color of top-fermented beers, creating a pleasant flavor. It forms an excellent enzyme-rich foundation for intensive colored beer styles. It is an excellent base malt for brewing many different styles of British Pale Ale as well as for brewing KÃ¶lsch beer.

recipe.name: 61 Three Hops Blonde v2
recipe.notes:
Target: ABV = 4.4 %, IBU = 24.
Malt is ordered with standard crush @ The Malt Miller (https://www.themaltmiller.co.uk/).
Pitch 3 grams of yeast.
